revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-26 07:56:04.000000000', 'message': "Use stable/yoga branch of openstacksdk in Bifrost jobs

Bifrost uses OpenStack's upper-constraints [1] to determine which
version of openstacksdk to install. At the moment this file is
edited to downgrade openstacksdk to release 0.61 [2].

By adding openstacksdk to Zuul variable job.required-projects [3],
Bifrost will install openstacksdk from its stable/yoga branch which
has the lastest release prior to 0.99.0.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/src/commit/b8ebbeb376e7056c1523a5539a34d9cdedea6b71/playbooks/ci/run.yaml#L15
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/commit/03ddd026567f7b61b89d83b0e7e7cb35ed466ae6
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/bifrost/+/849563/5/playbooks/test-bifrost.yaml

Change-Id: I46dadc70338bb45d459e8176cc26e67c20c1d4ae
"}]
commit_message:
Use stable/yoga branch of openstacksdk in Bifrost jobs

Bifrost uses OpenStack's upper-constraints [1] to determine which
version of openstacksdk to install. At the moment this file is
edited to downgrade openstacksdk to release 0.61 [2].

By adding openstacksdk to Zuul variable job.required-projects [3],
Bifrost will install openstacksdk from its stable/yoga branch which
has the lastest release prior to 0.99.0.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/src/commit/b8ebbeb376e7056c1523a5539a34d9cdedea6b71/playbooks/ci/run.yaml#L15
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/commit/03ddd026567f7b61b89d83b0e7e7cb35ed466ae6
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/bifrost/+/849563/5/playbooks/test-bifrost.yaml

Change-Id: I46dadc70338bb45d459e8176cc26e67c20c1d4ae

subject: [WIP] make os-vif jobs multinode and enable trunk testing
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-26 10:26:50.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] make os-vif jobs multinode and enable trunk testing

This change changes the base os-vif job to inherit the
multinode tempest base with a standard 2 node focal nodeset.

This will enable move operation testing in os-vif.
addtionaly we enable neutron trunk port support.

Change-Id: Ic1ebb33e8a315965e91a306ad6f1bfacb4b05a19
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] make os-vif jobs multinode and enable trunk testing

This change changes the base os-vif job to inherit the
multinode tempest base with a standard 2 node focal nodeset.

This will enable move operation testing in os-vif.
addtionaly we enable neutron trunk port support.

Change-Id: Ic1ebb33e8a315965e91a306ad6f1bfacb4b05a19

[{'created': '2022-03-24 09:08:39.000000000', 'message': "[DNM][OVN] Log drop events per security group

Right now dropped traffic is logged for all security groups
because there's only 1 general ACL for all of the port groups.
This patch creates extra ACLs for each SG that are associated to their
port group and collect all of the dropped traffic for them.

Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] Log drop events per security group

Right now dropped traffic is logged for all security groups
because there's only 1 general ACL for all of the port groups.
This patch creates extra ACLs for each SG that are associated to their
port group and collect all of their dropped traffic.

Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0df9e9e6ef927ada4d8047c810774c2632f003bb

patches for all supported stable branches.

[{'created': '2022-04-26 16:03:56.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add '.git-blame-ignore-revs'

This allows us to ignore this commit for git-blame purposes. While git
itself does not specify this file name, there appears to be an informal
standard to use this filename. For example, this is what Django [1] and
twisted [2] use.

WIP because the commit hash for the base patch will necessarily change
as it's rebased.

[1] https://github.com/django/django/blob/main/.git-blame-ignore-revs
[2] https://github.com/twisted/twisted/blob/trunk/.git-blame-ignore-revs

Change-Id: Iab327a91c7ad47e958b5f7ac3b98b2d3e9e21733
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Add '.git-blame-ignore-revs'

This allows us to ignore this commit for git-blame purposes. While git
itself does not specify this file name, there appears to be an informal
standard to use this filename. For example, this is what Django [1] and
twisted [2] use.

WIP because the commit hash for the base patch will necessarily change
as it's rebased.

[1] https://github.com/django/django/blob/main/.git-blame-ignore-revs
[2] https://github.com/twisted/twisted/blob/trunk/.git-blame-ignore-revs

Change-Id: Iab327a91c7ad47e958b5f7ac3b98b2d3e9e21733
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove return from rpc cast

This change removes return statement from rpc cast method calls.
As rpc cast are asynchronous, so doesn't return anything.

Change-Id: I766f64f2c086dd652bc28b338320cc94ccc48f1f
(cherry picked from commit 7824471b790acdbab8c99f965e87e7fb49c32719)

commit_message:
Update sensubility's container health check

Current logic parses podman log, which does not contain relevant
logs any more after podman update.

This patch makes it to get container health information straight
from podman using the podman socket.

Change-Id: I2a8c7d0797c3894a5593da407dd628a25e0535b8

commit_message:
Partially revert "Do not link up HA router gateway in backup node"

This partially reverts commit c52029c39aa824a67095fbbf9e59eff769d92587.

We revert everything except one minor addition to
neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py which ensures that ha_confs path is
created when the keepalived manager is initialised.

Closes-Bug: #1965297
Change-Id: I14ad015c4344b32f7210c924902dac4e6ad1ae88
(cherry picked from commit 36bf1df46df4de8f9ed0c19e1118480ce2e55d8a)
(cherry picked from commit 7cf7ae05659b363e54fbb04d2c02f91b17763921)

commit_message:
py310: Add required-projects list to py310 job

For unit test jobs neutworking-bagpipe needs horizon, networking-bgpvpn
and networking-sfc, so let's add these to py310 job also.

Change-Id: Ia28bd3e4aef40cd490e4a98283b1b2507350f56f

commit_message:
Add new multinode-mixed-os job and required content provider changes

Includes changes to pass the registry_distro var through to the toci
playbook executions. Also adds the registry_ip_address_distro and
_hash_distro into the content provider return data for use by the
mixed-os-job. See topic at [1] for related reviews.

The new job is in the tripleo-multinode-container-minimal-pipeline
layout so it will run across the tripleo repos (wallaby only).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:oooci_mixed_rhel

Change-Id: I1690fbece3ef8d40cef01ef0d10f5f5edbfe2747

commit_message:
Fix container image publish to Docker Hub

Publishing container images to Docker Hub was failing with:

    state is present but all of the following are missing: source

This is caused by the recent Ansible upgrade by Zuul [1]: the source
parameter is mandatory since Ansible 2.12.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/849120

Change-Id: I232fe835f5a650c258243f1ee4720480f2e6e7b1
(cherry picked from commit 2da76f78dee53ae84bfe6da051367d9b320af0f6)

parameter is mandatory since Ansible 2.12.

commit_message:
[OSC] Implement Share Server Commands

Added the implementation of the share server commands to OSC.
Commands are:

- openstack share server delete
- openstack share server show
- openstack share server list
- openstack share server adopt
- openstack share server abandon
- openstack share server set --status

Partially-implements: bp openstack-client-support

Co-Authored-By: Carlos da Silva <ces.eduardo98@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I01b0ee1a8092002d2c2aa916617b2db75654e8d8

This allows to use upper-constraints file as more

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I7361f0884cd8f14725b9a04c924593e8d2bfd60c

[{'created': '2022-07-26 08:45:55.000000000', 'message': 'Update python testing as per zed cycle testing runtime

In Zed cycle, we have dropped the python 3.6/3.7[1] testing
and its support. Removing the py36 centos8 job as well as
updating the python classifier also to reflect the same.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Change-Id: I432ed9263f32f0691d678ca08472eed579cb3ea5
'}]
commit_message:
Update python testing as per zed cycle testing runtime

In Zed cycle, we have dropped the python 3.6/3.7[1] testing
and its support. Removing the py36 centos8 job as well as
updating the python classifier also to reflect the same.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Change-Id: I432ed9263f32f0691d678ca08472eed579cb3ea5

commit_message:
Set the ironic notification level

To use notifications with ironic, the notification_level
option in the [DEFAULT] section of the configuration file
must be set, we use ``info`` as a reasonable level.

Closes-Bug: #1969826

Change-Id: I38bb1e5404e917c788689a3181741022f875da06

commit_message:

This new version adds support for jsonschema 4.x. It also requires
jsonschema 4.x.

commit_message:
TripleO: Switch to scenario 013

scenario 013 is more light-weighted as it does not have Ceph.

Conflicts:
	.zuul.yaml

Backport note:
This is directly backported from master because TripleO jobs have been
removed from xena and yoga.

Change-Id: I00af2b7c528f93b0f29f053f47f892693e3a947e
(cherry picked from commit ec3d4a77318ec44c627748154edbbb355d8271bb)

commit_message:
Use master branch of openstacksdk in Bifrost jobs

Bifrost downgrades openstacksdk to a release <0.99.0 [1], which is
incompatible to our master branch of the Ansible OpenStack
collection. By adding openstacksdk to Zuul variable job.required-\
projects [2], Bifrost will install openstacksdk from its master
branch, overwriting any existing (older) openstacksdk releases.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/commit/03ddd026567f7b61b89d83b0e7e7cb35ed466ae6
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/bifrost/+/849563/5/playbooks/test-bifrost.yaml

Change-Id: I46dadc70338bb45d459e8176cc26e67c20c1d4ae

commit_message:
Do not trigger functional jobs for unit test changes

Codes under the test directory are not used by actual functionality but
only by unit tests. Thus we don't need to run functional jobs in case
only these test codes are upated.

Change-Id: I0b0a64d3d7f526f73275917e7b05a7dfa294ec5c

commit_message:
Remove jsonschema upper version limit.

Setting up jsonschema version to upper limit
is causing failures in the pip package installation.

Related-Bug: #1982757

Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I7d9b186ed479f37d2feaf86a6e2409c197f6a72d

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-15 03:37:09.000000000', 'message': "formpost: deprecate sha1 signatures

We've known this would eventually be necessary for a while [1], and
way back in 2017 we started seeing SHA-1 collisions [2].

While we're at it, show formpoat some love by supporting more digests
akin to tempurl. I.e prepend the digest to the signature:

  sha256:<sig>
or
  sha512:<sig>

Give the formpost signiture an argparse overhaul so we can optionally
pass in a digest to use.

[1] https://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2012/10/when_will_we_se.html
[2] https://security.googleblog.com/2017/02/announcing-first-sha1-collision.html

Change-Id: I581cadd6bc79e623f1dae071025e4d375254c1d9

"}, {'created': '2022-06-30 06:23:52.000000000', 'message': "formpost: deprecate sha1 signatures

We've known this would eventually be necessary for a while [1], and
way back in 2017 we started seeing SHA-1 collisions [2].

This patch follows the approach of soft deprecation of SHA1 in tempurl.
It's still a default digest, but we'll start with warning as the
middleware is loaded.

Because formpost shares so much with tempurl, I've also gone and
refactored shared digest management code only used by these 2 middlewares into
some helper methods in swift/common/middleware/digest_utils.py

We could move it up into the common, or common.utils but because it's
only used down in 2 middlewares, a kept it contained in the middleware
namespace.

[1] https://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2012/10/when_will_we_se.html
[2] https://security.googleblog.com/2017/02/announcing-first-sha1-collision.html

Change-Id: I581cadd6bc79e623f1dae071025e4d375254c1d9
"}, {'created': '2022-07-01 01:33:09.000000000', 'message': "formpost: deprecate sha1 signatures

We've known this would eventually be necessary for a while [1], and
way back in 2017 we started seeing SHA-1 collisions [2].

This patch follows the approach of soft deprecation of SHA1 in tempurl.
It's still a default digest, but we'll start with warning as the
middleware is loaded.

Further, because there is much shared code between formpost and tempurl, this
patch also goes and refactors shared code out into swift.common.digest.
Now that we have a digest, we also move digest related code:
 - get_hmac
 - extract_digest_and_algorithm

[1] https://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2012/10/when_will_we_se.html
[2] https://security.googleblog.com/2017/02/announcing-first-sha1-collision.html

Change-Id: I581cadd6bc79e623f1dae071025e4d375254c1d9
"}, {'created': '2022-07-01 03:30:59.000000000', 'message': "formpost: deprecate sha1 signatures

"}, {'created': '2022-07-20 05:31:35.000000000', 'message': "formpost: deprecate sha1 signatures

We've known this would eventually be necessary for a while [1], and
way back in 2017 we started seeing SHA-1 collisions [2].

This patch follows the approach of soft deprecation of SHA1 in tempurl.
It's still a default digest, but we'll start with warning as the
middleware is loaded.

Further, because there is much shared code between formpost and tempurl, this
patch also goes and refactors shared code out into swift.common.digest.
Now that we have a digest, we also move digest related code:
 - get_hmac
 - extract_digest_and_algorithm

[1] https://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2012/10/when_will_we_se.html
[2] https://security.googleblog.com/2017/02/announcing-first-sha1-collision.html

Change-Id: I581cadd6bc79e623f1dae071025e4d375254c1d9

 - get_hmac

[1] https://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2012/10/when_will_we_se.html

commit_message:
formpost: deprecate sha1 signatures

We've known this would eventually be necessary for a while [1], and
way back in 2017 we started seeing SHA-1 collisions [2].

This patch follows the approach of soft deprecation of SHA1 in tempurl.
It's still a default digest, but we'll start with warning as the
middleware is loaded and exposing any deprecated digests
(if they're still allowed) in /info.

Further, because there is much shared code between formpost and tempurl, this
patch also goes and refactors shared code out into swift.common.digest.
Now that we have a digest, we also move digest related code:
 - get_hmac
 - extract_digest_and_algorithm

[1] https://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2012/10/when_will_we_se.html
[2] https://security.googleblog.com/2017/02/announcing-first-sha1-collision.html

Change-Id: I581cadd6bc79e623f1dae071025e4d375254c1d9

commit_message:
Fix existing nodes check

If there is no allocation with hostname assume the node
does not exist. This would avoid issues when node and
hostname naming scheme are identical.

Resolves: rhbz#2092444
Change-Id: I29de51c63fafff7394723e05fc556649ccd73d7b

commit_message:
Support CNF Heal in v2 LCM API

This specification enhances version 2 (v2) of
Heal API for supporting CNF.
Previous release supported VNF Lifecycle Management (LCM) operations
defined in ETSI NFV SOL002 v3.3.1 and SOL003 v3.3.1.
However, v2 Heal API has not supported CNF yet.
This specification enables v2 Heal API to handle CNF.

Change-Id: Ib11a2e9ae2c525959ebdac499427cd694ff0122d
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-heal-vnf

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: Ide356fda579cc77e8414446a818dec7749687b9d

commit_message:
Revert "CentOS 9: Disable unit tests dependent on puppet-postgresql"

This reverts commit 83f966a8501c079d9e41edaa68e2e4e6b6838ced.

Reason for revert:
puppet-postgresql 8.1.0 was released and now the module supports RHEL 9
(and CentOS 9 effectively).

Note:
This change adds the service_provider fact in test fact data because
it is required by puppet-postgresql.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/850705
Change-Id: I2845d25c5f2de57e104d09284f0c5aedcd5d0362

[{'created': '2022-07-19 14:47:30.000000000', 'message': 'Drain and close response in StaticLargeObject.get_slo_segments

In get_slo_segments a GET subrequest is processed to get SLO manifest,
but if the object is not a SLO the response was not drain/closed.

commit_message:
Drain and close response in StaticLargeObject.get_slo_segments

In get_slo_segments a GET subrequest is processed to get SLO manifest,
but if the object is not a SLO the response was not drain/closed.

Closes-Bug: 1980954
Change-Id: I7862c8ef153416c00c8ca7d6bf2f3556a1776d8c

commit_message:
squash: rework get_allowed_digests API

Hard-coding the option name like that doesn't feel right; callers should
be responsible for their options.

May as well make the logger optional, too.

Change-Id: I5a043598e1c5b6a77d571a000e0cf2da77e465d9

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-15 01:43:01.000000000', 'message': 'Support CNF Scale in v2 LCM API

This specification enhances version 2 (v2) of Scale API
for supporting CNF.
Previous release supported VNF Lifecycle Management (LCM) operations
defined in ETSI NFV SOL002 v3.3.1 and SOL003 v3.3.1.
However, v2 Scale API has not supported CNF yet.
This specification enables v2 Scale API to handle CNF.

Change-Id: I0a856508a22754eaa34ac2bb66137382209d416a
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-scale-vnf
'}, {'created': '2022-07-22 08:07:33.000000000', 'message': 'Support CNF Scale in v2 LCM API

This specification enhances version 2 (v2) of Scale API
for supporting CNF.
Previous release supported VNF Lifecycle Management (LCM) operations
defined in ETSI NFV SOL002 v3.3.1 and SOL003 v3.3.1.
However, v2 Scale API has not supported CNF yet.
This specification enables v2 Scale API to handle CNF.

Change-Id: I0a856508a22754eaa34ac2bb66137382209d416a
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-scale-vnf
'}]
commit_message:
Support CNF Scale in v2 LCM API

This specification enhances version 2 (v2) of Scale API
for supporting CNF.
Previous release supported VNF Lifecycle Management (LCM) operations
defined in ETSI NFV SOL002 v3.3.1 and SOL003 v3.3.1.
However, v2 Scale API has not supported CNF yet.
This specification enables v2 Scale API to handle CNF.

Change-Id: I0a856508a22754eaa34ac2bb66137382209d416a
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-scale-vnf

[{'created': '2022-07-19 08:45:44.000000000', 'message': "Galera: initial support for mariabackup SST

When deploying a HA overcloud, allow the SST method to be
configured, to use either rsync (default) or mariabackup.

Tested by deploying a HA overcloud with mariabackup SST
(IPv4, IPv6, TLS-e) as well as with regular rsync SST
(IPv4, IPv6, TLS-e).

Note that this initial support doesn't allow SST method
to be updated via a stack update, as mariabackup requires
a dedicated MySQL user, and there is currently no
orchestration available via a minor update either.

Closes-Bug: #1973872
Depends-On: I1509bd30fbd253790b17e04ef15dca6c58de7311
Depends-On: I4d5983ada52a58cdd853bd7b701bb11eeb88be8d

(cherry picked from commit 4cceeebc86b99f76abaf15990e14d85406628be1)
"}]
commit_message:
Galera: initial support for mariabackup SST

When deploying a HA overcloud, allow the SST method to be
configured, to use either rsync (default) or mariabackup.

Tested by deploying a HA overcloud with mariabackup SST
(IPv4, IPv6, TLS-e) as well as with regular rsync SST
(IPv4, IPv6, TLS-e).

Note that this initial support doesn't allow SST method
to be updated via a stack update, as mariabackup requires
a dedicated MySQL user, and there is currently no
orchestration available via a minor update either.

Closes-Bug: #1973872
Depends-On: I1509bd30fbd253790b17e04ef15dca6c58de7311
Depends-On: I4d5983ada52a58cdd853bd7b701bb11eeb88be8d

(Fixed cherry-pick conflict in ContainerCli allowed_values)

Change-Id: I6b797141800ae7f1773e9a06b232dacd158732f5
(cherry picked from commit 4cceeebc86b99f76abaf15990e14d85406628be1)

commit_message:
Make the dark data watcher work with sharded containers

Be willing to accept shards instead of objects when querying containers.
If we receive shards, be willing to query them looking for the object.

Change-Id: I0d8dd42f81b97dddd6cf8910afaef4ba85e67d27
Partial-Bug: #1925346

[{'created': '2021-05-03 20:43:49.000000000', 'message': "Only log warnings about token length when length exceeds max_token_size

Previously, the fernet token provider would log warnings when a fernet
token exceeded 255 characters, which is common for LDAP-backed
deployments. The warning is always issued, even when operators configure
keystone's max_token_size to a higher value, causing confusion because
it appears the configuration value is silently ignored.

parameter consistently in the fernet token provider.

Change-Id: I4bb54aac9b950d59082a4468203a3249790839d7
"}, {'created': '2021-05-03 20:44:17.000000000', 'message': "Only log warnings about token length when length exceeds max_token_size

Previously, the fernet token provider would log warnings when a fernet
token exceeded 255 characters, which is common for LDAP-backed
deployments. The warning is always issued, even when operators configure
keystone's max_token_size to a higher value, causing confusion because

commit_message:
Only log warnings about token length when length exceeds max_token_size

Previously, the fernet token provider would log warnings when a fernet
token exceeded 255 characters, which is common for LDAP-backed
deployments. The warning is always issued, even when operators configure
keystone's max_token_size to a higher value, causing confusion because
it appears the configuration value is silently ignored.

This commit fixes that issue by using the max_token_size configuration
parameter consistently in the fernet token provider.

Closes-Bug: 1926483

Change-Id: I4bb54aac9b950d59082a4468203a3249790839d7

container, you basically NEVER want that container's info to ever fall

commit_message:
proxy: Add a chance to skip memcache for get_*_info calls

If you've got thousands of requests per second for objects in a single
container, you basically NEVER want that container's info to ever fall
out of memcache. If it *does*, all those clients are almost certainly
going to overload the container.

Avoid this by allowing some small fraction of requests to bypass and
refresh the cache, pushing out the TTL as long as there continue to be
requests to the container. The likelihood of skipping the cache is
configurable, similar to what we did for shard range sets.

Change-Id: I1a9cd7610f685be03b1753836296b9af8f2b2609
Closes-Bug: #1883324

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-30 13:01:19.000000000', 'message': "Reduce memory consumption in Cinder services

This patch reduces memory usage on the Cinder Volume and Backup services
by tuning glibc.

The specific tuning consist on disabling the per thread arenas and
disabling dynamic thresholds.

The Cinder Backup service suffers from high water mark memory usage and
uses excessive memory.  As an example just after 10 restore operations
the service uses almost 1GB of RAM and does not ever free it afterwards.
With this patch the memory consumption of the service is reduced down to
almost 130MB.  If we add a revert from Cinder (Change-Id
I43a20c8687f12bc52b014611cc6977c4c3ca212c) it goes down to 100MB during
my tests.

This glibc tuning is not applied to all Python services because I
haven't done proper testings on them and at first glance they don't seem
to have such great improvements.

Related-bug: #1908805
Change-Id: Ic9030d01468b3189350f83b04a8d1d346c489d3c
(cherry picked from commit d5af514ac9485009229f3b594bccc09e905782fb)
(cherry picked from commit eb16f28ab2ee5ab8642bb404e1d0bcec75399f32)
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce memory consumption in Cinder services

This patch reduces memory usage on the Cinder Volume and Backup services
by tuning glibc.

The specific tuning consist on disabling the per thread arenas and
disabling dynamic thresholds.

The Cinder Backup service suffers from high water mark memory usage and
uses excessive memory.  As an example just after 10 restore operations
the service uses almost 1GB of RAM and does not ever free it afterwards.
With this patch the memory consumption of the service is reduced down to
almost 130MB.  If we add a revert from Cinder (Change-Id
I43a20c8687f12bc52b014611cc6977c4c3ca212c) it goes down to 100MB during
my tests.

This glibc tuning is not applied to all Python services because I
haven't done proper testings on them and at first glance they don't seem
to have such great improvements.

Related-bug: #1908805
Change-Id: Ic9030d01468b3189350f83b04a8d1d346c489d3c
(cherry picked from commit d5af514ac9485009229f3b594bccc09e905782fb)
(cherry picked from commit eb16f28ab2ee5ab8642bb404e1d0bcec75399f32)

commit_message:
Refactor docker image task values

Due to an ansible upgrade, the docker_image tasks are currently
failing. This was due to a change in ansible, several values were
deprecated and moved/renamed.

This change modifies the docker_image task definitions to be
up-to-date with the latest ansible changes to fix the gate.

Change-Id: I653cd55256426f8fac3fce2fed460a14aa6b1d37

[{'created': '2022-02-25 22:48:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix prometheus-proxy systemd service

This patch changes the inter-dependency between the prometheus-proxy
systemd service unit and the amphora-agent service. This will stop
systemd from shutting down the prometheus proxy should the amphora
agent be stopped.

Change-Id: I30c6c5809cc8568159feca193f38f62ca09874fd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix prometheus-proxy systemd service

This patch changes the inter-dependency between the prometheus-proxy
systemd service unit and the amphora-agent service. This will stop
systemd from shutting down the prometheus proxy should the amphora
agent be stopped.

Change-Id: I30c6c5809cc8568159feca193f38f62ca09874fd

Remove the Security pages as they are being migrated
to the charm-guide.

The security overview page was completely removed
(not migrated) as its contents did not warrant a page

commit_message:
Fix skip_list definition for yamllint

It seems recent update of ansible-lint no longer allows us to use
top-level name but only accepts yaml[<name>] syntax to skip yaml lint
checks. This change updates the config file of ansible-lint to ensure
all yaml lint checks are skipped.

This also skips the experimental checks to skip a few errors currently
detected.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/850893
Change-Id: Icac9f7c4d6501536467e286311dde34cc7cee198

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie8bc408edb8485fed0602f9f119feb0536b90cfc

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-31 17:59:07.000000000', 'message': 'NVMe-oF: Consolidate code paths

We currently have 2 different connection information formats: The
initial one and the new one.

Within the new format we have 2 variants: Replicated and Not replicated.

In the end the nvmeof connector ends up with multiple code paths and we
end up finding bugs that affect one path and not the other and things
that are present in both but are only fixed on one of them.

This patch consolidates both formats as much as possible by converting
the provided connection information into a common representation that is
99% like the newest format.

The only difference between the internal representation and the newest
format is the transport protocols, which are translated into "rdma" and
"tcp" to facilitate it's usage within the code.

Thanks to this consolidation the Cinder drivers are less restricted on
how they can identify a volume in the connection information.  They are
no longer forced to pass the NVMe UUID (in case they cannot get that
information or the backend doesn't support it) and they can provide
other information instead (nguid or namespace id).

By consolidating the formats and the code paths a number of bugs get
fixed automatically, because they were broken in one path but not in the
other.  As examples, the old code path didn't have rescans but the new
one did, and the old code path had device flush but the new one didn't.

The patch also takes this opportunity to better document the nvmeof
connector and to add the connector to the docs.

Closes-Bug: #1964590
Closes-Bug: #1964395
Closes-Bug: #1964388
Closes-Bug: #1964385
Closes-Bug: #1964380
Closes-Bug: #1964383
Closes-Bug: #1965954
Closes-Bug: #1903032
Related-Bug: #1961102
Change-Id: I6c2a952f7e286f3e3890e3f2fcb2fdd1063f0c17
'}, {'created': '2022-04-12 14:47:31.000000000', 'message': 'NVMe-oF: Consolidate code paths

We currently have 2 different connection information formats: The
initial one and the new one.

Within the new format we have 2 variants: Replicated and Not replicated.

In the end the nvmeof connector ends up with multiple code paths and we
end up finding bugs that affect one path and not the other and things
that are present in both but are only fixed on one of them.

This patch consolidates both formats as much as possible by converting
the provided connection information into a common representation that is
99% like the newest format.

The only difference between the internal representation and the newest
format is the transport protocols, which are translated into "rdma" and
"tcp" to facilitate it's usage within the code.

Thanks to this consolidation the Cinder drivers are less restricted on
how they can identify a volume in the connection information.  They are
no longer forced to pass the NVMe UUID (in case they cannot get that
information or the backend doesn't support it) and they can provide
other information instead (nguid or namespace id).

By consolidating the formats and the code paths a number of bugs get
fixed automatically, because they were broken in one path but not in the
other.  As examples, the old code path didn't have rescans but the new
one did, and the old code path had device flush but the new one didn't.

The patch also takes this opportunity to better document the nvmeof
connector and to add the connector to the docs.

present in both may end up getting fixed in only one of them.

information into a common internal representation, thus reducing the
number of code paths.

how they can identify a volume in the connection information.  They are
no longer forced to pass the NVMe UUID (in case they cannot get that
information or the backend doesn't support it) and they can provide
other information instead (nguid or namespace id).

NVMeOFConnProps class docstring.

automatically, because they were broken in one path but not in the
other.  As examples, the old code path didn't have rescans but the new

  harder to read and error prone dictionaries and tuples.

- Adds method annotations.

- Documents most methods (exect the raid ones which I'm not familiar
  with)

- Adds the connector to the docs.

- Makes method signatures conform with Cinder team standards: no more
  static methods passing self and no more calling class methods using
  the class name instead of self.

commit_message:
NVMe-oF: Consolidate code paths

We currently have 2 different connection information formats: The
initial one and the new one.

Within the new format we have 2 variants: Replicated and Not replicated.

Currently the nvmeof connector has multiple code paths and we end up
finding bugs that affect one path and not the other, and bugs that are
present in both may end up getting fixed in only one of them.

This patch consolidates both formats by converting the connection
information into a common internal representation, thus reducing the
number of code paths.

Thanks to this consolidation the Cinder drivers are less restricted on
how they can identify a volume in the connection information.  They are
no longer forced to pass the NVMe UUID (in case they cannot get that
information or the backend doesn't support it) and they can provide
other information instead (nguid or namespace id).

This connection properties format consolidation is explained in the new
NVMeOFConnProps class docstring.

By consolidating the code paths a number of bugs get fixed
automatically, because they were broken in one path but not in the
other.  As examples, the old code path didn't have rescans but the new
one did, and the old code path had device flush but the new one didn't.

Given the big refactoring needed to consolidate everything this patch
also accomplishes the following things:

- Uses Portal, Target, and NVMeOFConnProps classes instead of using the
  harder to read and error prone dictionaries and tuples.

- Adds method annotations.

- Documents most methods (exect the raid ones which I'm not familiar
  with)

- Adds the connector to the docs.

- Makes method signatures conform with Cinder team standards: no more
  static methods passing self and no more calling class methods using
  the class name instead of self.

Closes-Bug: #1964590
Closes-Bug: #1964395
Closes-Bug: #1964388
Closes-Bug: #1964385
Closes-Bug: #1964380
Closes-Bug: #1964383
Closes-Bug: #1965954
Closes-Bug: #1903032
Related-Bug: #1961102
Change-Id: I6c2a952f7e286f3e3890e3f2fcb2fdd1063f0c17

commit_message:
Add support for running glance-api by httpd+mod_wsgi

This change introduces a basic implementation to run glance-api as
an application managed by httpd+mod_wsgi, instead of a standalone
eventlet server.

Change-Id: I9421ec891c535503ff61ad6107a1935a32b4b263

commit_message:
Revert "CentOS 9: Disable unit tests dependent on puppet-postgresql"

This reverts commit ae04e3ac34b152087f37d96836e2042c64c6d36d.

Reason for revert:
puppet-postgresql 8.1.0 was released and now the module supports RHEL 9
(and CentOS 9 effectively).

Note:
This change adds the service_provider fact in test fact data because
it is required by puppet-postgresql.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/850705
Change-Id: I6cfea1ca8dbf7633ea6b3805666237ec43533b4b

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Change-Id: I2eea42d3909896ea8606dc9cde681b2cc1cfb62f
(cherry picked from commit 36510a81b03e9a8ede57db48a945a5a84f16cf40)
(cherry picked from commit 4992bcf219d69b2dd5909bb6b80f16ec2e1915a8)
(cherry picked from commit 45e04a0fdb87196c99754d26af75700147c338b7)
(cherry picked from commit 60b4a24053418f0e3bdee56d57cbcd7908fc8ccf)
(cherry picked from commit cc80506233b7d46061734296ec820cf6c3d6b4fd)

commit_message:
Drop lower-constrait job

Lower-constraints is not required and has been dropped from Keystone
because of an issue with the new dependency resolver in pip[1].
The job is currently broken so let's disable it to unblock gate first.

[1] d6610594d1b766a8ee3ac65182b951f2a3d431f7

Change-Id: I67b8981b211c5d15154c919ea6f4f75639863437
(cherry picked from commit 0c4e2940ff709d47dd1ea7ffe34b70d451c67434)
(cherry picked from commit 5a34011e83cb840fd36ad9edb19cc3b0fff9293b)

commit_message:
Revert "CentOS 9: Disable unit tests dependent on puppet-postgresql"

This reverts commit a8fa9f2788e269306964cb235b69121f8acdd6ea.

Reason for revert:
puppet-postgresql 8.1.0 was released and now the module supports RHEL 9
(and CentOS 9 effectively).

Note:
This change adds the service_provider fact in test fact data because
it is required by puppet-postgresql.
This also reverts commit a36a020f47063f561605c6e33b3c4574e643e9ca which
fixed the typo in the original commit.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/850705
Change-Id: Icf69dc0461e3171d55e9583e0164d450477f68c1

commit_message:
Copy security pages from deploy-guide

This PR is part of the ongoing work to migrate pages
from the deploy-guide to the charm-guide that are not
specific to a manual test cloud deployment.

The filename for the TLS page was renamed to tls.rst .

Some links necessarily needed to be changed in some
files.

Two trivial format corrections were made:

 i) in keystone.rst
    _keyston_tokens: => _keystone_tokens:

ii) in tls.rst
    csr => CSR

Change-Id: I20e89f4daa21f853ebaec8d928a7d0dc479512d8

commit_message:
Replace deprecated readfp method with read_file

The readfp method has been deprecated since version 3.2 [1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/configparser.html?highlight=deprecated#configparser.ConfigParser.readfp

Change-Id: Ib4d13e850e47c80ca6ec601b9e195337d9a403e0

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-19 18:24:01.000000000', 'message': "[CI] Refactor jobs to pin tempest plugin version

Tempest is pinned to a 26.1.0 on this stable
branch [1]. manila-tempest-plugin in Zed requires a newer
tempest release [2] than this one. So, pin
manila-tempest-plugin as well to a version that can still
work with the pinned version of tempest. We can do this
only by overriding the jobs on this branch unfortunately.

Also, manila's test image (built from manila-image-elements)
is based off of Ubuntu 22.04 (Jammy Jellyfish) in the Zed
release; we don't need that image to be used to test this
stable branch and we could use an older version (based on
Ubuntu 20.04 - Focal Fossa) that requires less memory/CPU [3]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/838051
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/+/849995
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/+/846061

Change-Id: I23827477d3c25eb2b10bea6d62885d50a28ec0a0
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[CI] Refactor jobs to pin tempest plugin version

Tempest is pinned to a 26.1.0 on this stable
branch [1]. manila-tempest-plugin in Zed requires a newer
tempest release [2] than this one. So, pin
manila-tempest-plugin as well to a version that can still
work with the pinned version of tempest. We can do this
only by overriding the jobs on this branch unfortunately.

Also, manila's test image (built from manila-image-elements)
is based off of Ubuntu 22.04 (Jammy Jellyfish) in the Zed
release; we don't need that image to be used to test this
stable branch and we could use an older version (based on
Ubuntu 20.04 - Focal Fossa) that requires less memory/CPU [3]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/838051
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/+/849995
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/+/846061

Change-Id: I23827477d3c25eb2b10bea6d62885d50a28ec0a0
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for yoga

The bundles for the yoga channel currently point to "latest/edge"
channel for all the charms.  This update points the charms to the
appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,
openstack, ovn or the misc tracks.

Change-Id: Iba916c9db8e0db16515a6a50b8d7cbb2e533c5a7

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-04 20:25:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix restart on config-changed prior to upgrade-charm

Upgrade-charm code needs to make various adjustments to
the config files, but the code is currently running
config-changed and getting stuck in a restart loop
before upgrade-charm is able to run to make the config
adjustments.

This change adds a condition to skip the restart on that
specific upgrade-charm hook situation, to be invoked after
upgrade-charm code finishes.

Closes-bug: #1980693
Related-bug: #1927981
Change-Id: If9d71bdb839c9c0ee3f4b33e4d44a5c93bdd13de
'}, {'created': '2022-07-04 20:58:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix restart on config-changed prior to upgrade-charm

commit_message:
Fix restarts during upgrade-charm hook

Upgrade-charm code needs to make various adjustments to
the config files and restart the mysql-router service,
but the code is currently running config-changed and
getting stuck in a restart loop before upgrade-charm
is able to run to make the config adjustments and
invoke a successful restart.

This change adds a condition to skip the execution of
config_changed function when upgrade-charm hook runs,
so upgrade_charm code takes care of the adjustments.

Also, now upgrade-charm hook is guaranteed to restart the
mysql-router service whenever any change to the config
file is made as part of its execution, whereas before
it wasn't doing so when making the adjustments of the
custom upgrade_charm function, resulting in the possibility
of no restarts after a charm upgrade.

This change includes the now-abandoned change:
https://review.opendev.org/848748

Co-Authored-By: Felipe Reyes <felipe.reyes@canonical.com>

Closes-bug: #1980693
Closes-bug: #1979263
Related-bug: #1927981
Change-Id: If9d71bdb839c9c0ee3f4b33e4d44a5c93bdd13de

the charm being used, either from ceph, openstack, ovn or the
misc tracks for wallaby.

compatible only to openstacksdk >=0.99.0. When Bifrost is used

collection.

commit_message:
Downgrade openstacksdk to <0.99.0 conditionally

The master branch of the Ansible OpenStack collection [1] is
compatible only to openstacksdk >=0.99.0. When Bifrost is used
with its master branch, as it is in its Bifrost jobs [2], then
do not downgrade openstacksdk. This allows us to test Bifrost
against the latest openstacksdk and the latest Ansible OpenStack
collection.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack/src/commit/2d60a045a68a47cf1dd13c61493809dcb8c5aedd/.zuul.yaml#L284

Change-Id: Ib29d70067defc3219d4d75d89eb6f0b6f1cef289

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-15 12:17:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix to get HOME environment in dhcp-provisioning validation

The validation of dhcp-provisioning fails because it doesn't see
the correct path of undercloud.conf. The playbook has "become: true",
so the ansible_env.HOME is the home directory of root.

lookup(env, HOME) can get the home directory for the user.

Change-Id: I7c7de26f09f36d88b777be76027ad4ac66deda6b
(cherry picked from commit 8e4958cd7575c8c42da02976b4fad1e4f30924c7)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix to get HOME environment in dhcp-provisioning validation

The validation of dhcp-provisioning fails because it doesn't see
the correct path of undercloud.conf. The playbook has "become: true",
so the ansible_env.HOME is the home directory of root.

lookup(env, HOME) can get the home directory for the user.

Change-Id: I7c7de26f09f36d88b777be76027ad4ac66deda6b
(cherry picked from commit 8e4958cd7575c8c42da02976b4fad1e4f30924c7)

commit_message:
Add IPA client service to Cell ctrlr role

Align Controller/Cell controller roles to contain
missing IPA client services.
Cell controllers must as well register as IPA clients.

Related: rhbz#2064830
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1a3a81537dcd538f2ed1e87405067d4e0f259e83
(cherry picked from commit d5e7fd5b1f4f7c7a0230792076ac661bd842c57d)
(cherry picked from commit ff09cfa202054264ecfa22bcc6c96c40ff114e6c)

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Change-Id: I2eea42d3909896ea8606dc9cde681b2cc1cfb62f
(cherry picked from commit 36510a81b03e9a8ede57db48a945a5a84f16cf40)
(cherry picked from commit 4992bcf219d69b2dd5909bb6b80f16ec2e1915a8)
(cherry picked from commit 45e04a0fdb87196c99754d26af75700147c338b7)
(cherry picked from commit 60b4a24053418f0e3bdee56d57cbcd7908fc8ccf)

commit_message:
Drop lower-constrait job

Lower-constraints is not required and has been dropped from Keystone
because of an issue with the new dependency resolver in pip[1].
The job is currently broken so let's disable it to unblock gate first.

[1] d6610594d1b766a8ee3ac65182b951f2a3d431f7

Change-Id: I67b8981b211c5d15154c919ea6f4f75639863437
(cherry picked from commit 0c4e2940ff709d47dd1ea7ffe34b70d451c67434)
(cherry picked from commit 5a34011e83cb840fd36ad9edb19cc3b0fff9293b)
(cherry picked from commit cb2faabe4016550df7963bc61c5d46f7a85c8a12)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-20 18:10:06.000000000', 'message': "CI: Only setup fake v6 interface if needed

In the case of CI test nodes natively supporting and using ipv6,
we don't need to actually setup a fake IPv6 network for ports
to bind to on the local system. So before doin gso, lets check
to see if we can ping the address first. If not, then set it up.

Change-Id: Ib68c706c1f9ef0ad0cf27e7a6acffd2c50ff37ea
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Only setup fake v6 interface if needed

In the case of CI test nodes natively supporting and using ipv6,
we don't need to actually setup a fake IPv6 network for ports
to bind to on the local system. So before doin gso, lets check
to see if we can ping the address first. If not, then set it up.

Change-Id: Ib68c706c1f9ef0ad0cf27e7a6acffd2c50ff37ea

[{'created': '2022-07-20 14:25:56.000000000', 'message': "CI: Save routing table information for troubleshooting

Presently, we don't save the state of the routing table,
which means troubleshooting the ipv6 job failures is difficult
because we just have no way of knowing what is truly going on
with the traffic flow.

Possibly, we may be encountering a case where router
advertisements are overrriding route table entries, and
the only way to know is to see the final state of the table.

Change-Id: Ib15cd21e47e3b884bae2cb956f9113e73034391b
"}, {'created': '2022-07-20 18:10:06.000000000', 'message': "CI: Save routing table information for troubleshooting

with the traffic flow.

Possibly, we may be encountering a case where router
advertisements are overrriding route table entries, and
the only way to know is to see the final state of the table.

Change-Id: Ib15cd21e47e3b884bae2cb956f9113e73034391b
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Save routing table information for troubleshooting

Presently, we don't save the state of the routing table,
which means troubleshooting the ipv6 job failures is difficult
because we just have no way of knowing what is truly going on
with the traffic flow.

Possibly, we may be encountering a case where router
advertisements are overrriding route table entries, and
the only way to know is to see the final state of the table.

Change-Id: Ib15cd21e47e3b884bae2cb956f9113e73034391b

commit_message:
Switch stable/ussuri federation job to use ubuntu xenial

This is being proposed directly for stable/ussuri, since the
change only affects and makes sense on the stable/ussuri branch,
and it only touches the testing infrastructure.

The opensuse base which we are currently using these tests has
issues.

Change-Id: Ifab609fc42622c7d8f350e699275b541848f1a8a

commit_message:
[ML2 OVN] Add disable_ovn_dhcp_for_baremetal_ports parameter

This parameter can be used to disable OVN's DHCP when used with
baremetal ports.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/840316
Related-Bug: #1971431
Change-Id: If38730c5757bdaa6c19ece02c05106f191b91048

[{'created': '2022-06-22 17:00:55.000000000', 'message': 'Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades
from bionic-queens to bionic-train (with each intermediate
step needed).  Crucially it does NOT set a default
openstack-origin, which means installing train/stable
without specifying the openstack-origin will result in a
bionic-queens installation.  This is intentional as the branch
covers queens to train.

Change-Id: I347a922254b7983c8f4eab527d87bc337a2c7a67

commit_message:
Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades
from bionic-queens to bionic-train (with each intermediate
step needed).  Crucially it does NOT set a default
openstack-origin, which means installing train/stable
without specifying the openstack-origin will result in a
bionic-queens installation.  This is intentional as the branch
covers queens to train.

Change-Id: I347a922254b7983c8f4eab527d87bc337a2c7a67

commit_message:
Add OpenConfig classes for switch vlans

Add python classes for the subset of the following OpenConfig
modules required for createing/deleting vlans on a device.

* http://openconfig.net/yang/vlan

Story: 2009961
Task: 44991
Change-Id: Ie7a6cff1d37f095fb41e0f68b4ef68c4e5efcf8b

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-23 10:56:10.000000000', 'message': 'Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades
from bionic-queens to bionic-train (with each intermediate
step needed).  Crucially it does NOT set a default
openstack-origin, which means installing train/stable
without specifying the openstack-origin will result in a
bionic-queens installation.  This is intentional as the branch
covers queens to train.

Change-Id: I6896bbf151cfb9986b21103ab3c719fd06d28cc2
'}, {'created': '2022-07-23 10:59:30.000000000', 'message': 'Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

step needed).  Crucially it does NOT set a default
openstack-origin, which means installing train/stable
without specifying the openstack-origin will result in a
bionic-queens installation.  This is intentional as the branch
covers queens to train.

Change-Id: I6896bbf151cfb9986b21103ab3c719fd06d28cc2
'}]
commit_message:
Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades
from bionic-queens to bionic-train (with each intermediate
step needed).  Crucially it does NOT set a default
openstack-origin, which means installing train/stable
without specifying the openstack-origin will result in a
bionic-queens installation.  This is intentional as the branch
covers queens to train.

Change-Id: I6896bbf151cfb9986b21103ab3c719fd06d28cc2

commit_message:
Enable Designate in Ubuntu

It was disabled by 995e6056d1bfc923599a87f19e3dd5fe90a2e9aa in the past
because of broken idempotency but we no longer observe the problem in
recent releases like wallaby.

Change-Id: I57323a50e5bd016375eeaa3ececf813a3f48d0f6

commit_message:
CentOS 9: Switch back to puppetlabs packages

CnetOS 9 packages were already released in the puppetlabs repo.

This removes the workaround to use RDO packages, which was earlier
added to run integration jobs on CentOS Stream 9 before the packages
were released[1].

[1] f384effdb42e0cbe19e137f0411b09ac8fef5b48

Conflicts:
	functions

Change-Id: I0b9529b6a4f1c4beefa72b6e32b586b1ac9bea73
(cherry picked from commit f94e042df557c5932f6e911d473da42c00b27ed9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-28 23:40:54.000000000', 'message': 'Debian/Ubuntu: Fix priority setting to pin ceph packages

Since 13044d9f9e8fe0385ba68a458a301cc82188f08b was merged, we use
the upstream ceph repo to pull packages for Ubuntu, and this broke
the priority setting to avoid installing ceph packages from UCA repo.

This change fixes that and ensure the priority is configured with
the ceph repo.

Change-Id: I7b187d59f169689a7acd5cab013bb74d5cdfbf52

'}, {'created': '2022-07-14 02:28:31.000000000', 'message': 'Debian/Ubuntu: Fix priority setting to pin ceph packages

Since 13044d9f9e8fe0385ba68a458a301cc82188f08b was merged, we use
the upstream ceph repo to pull packages for Ubuntu, and this broke
the priority setting to avoid installing ceph packages from UCA repo.

This change fixes that and ensure the priority is configured with
the ceph repo.

Backport note:
This change includes 972a226ab7ca964e2254cd574362c9e170dfbebf which
fixed the circular dependencies caused by the original change.

Change-Id: I7b187d59f169689a7acd5cab013bb74d5cdfbf52
(cherry picked from commit cfdf592942f1d2153eb0a3d0a4c7a0026cceda07)

commit_message:
Debian/Ubuntu: Fix priority setting to pin ceph packages

Since 13044d9f9e8fe0385ba68a458a301cc82188f08b was merged, we use
the upstream ceph repo to pull packages for Ubuntu, and this broke
the priority setting to avoid installing ceph packages from UCA repo.

This change fixes that and ensure the priority is configured with
the ceph repo.

Backport note:
This change includes 972a226ab7ca964e2254cd574362c9e170dfbebf which
fixed the circular dependencies caused by the original change.

Change-Id: I7b187d59f169689a7acd5cab013bb74d5cdfbf52
(cherry picked from commit cfdf592942f1d2153eb0a3d0a4c7a0026cceda07)

commit_message:
Remove the note of training-labs

Training-labs had been officially retired as no maintainer.
The information of training-labs has been deleting in the openstack
documentatioan. It is not appropriate to continue the presentation in
note form here.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-October/025586.html
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/training-labs/commit/e78d74f10558ab3e6a9a6fd7d45e617c15e9c3d8

Change-Id: I0ac3d05389041ac58fe2347171541ffaaf151fdf

commit_message:
support image registries with authentication

Based on spec in openstack-helm repo,
support-OCI-image-registry-with-authentication-turned-on.rst

Each Helm chart can configure an OCI image registry and
credentials to use. A Kubernetes secret is then created with these
info. Service Accounts then specify an imagePullSecret specifying
the Secret with creds for the registry. Then any pod using one
of these ServiceAccounts may pull images from an authenticated
container registry.

Change-Id: Iebda4c7a861aa13db921328776b20c14ba346269

commit_message:
Remove resource types for per-daemon config files

Since yoga relase, this module no longer uses separate config files for
individual daemons but use the single trove.conf [1].

This change removes the remaining resource types for the separate
.conf files, which should have been removed by the cleanup patch[2].

[1] f1c11c68d56e4f1ad5125fa0df04ab91d929cd33
[2] 4d87fa2c694adb33607fa33273faa849792351b1

Change-Id: I66c1ccedc2ef1a73b5ee3f053b843e97be0d59b4

commit_message:
Configure the oslo.concurrency lock_path

A recent change in os-brick [1], which is used by cinder backends,
requires external file locks. This patch adds support for configuring
the lock path, with a default value that matches the corresponding
lock paths used by other services that use os-brick (namely cinder
and nova).

[1] I6f7f7d19540361204d4ae3ead2bd6dcddb8fcd68

Closes-Bug: #1980539
Change-Id: I5ea6766656f4227a1c514777c03bbf78d4ac59cd
(cherry picked from commit 6f61ecd9c5b030817d0255fd8fd485722f9556f4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-07 15:30:29.000000000', 'message': 'Skip clean up tasks for litmus tests

The copy_logs.sh script captures log files according to the manifests
installed.

However in litmus tests, the clean up task is executed and removes
all modules before the copy_logs.sh script is executed, and currently
no OpenStack service logs are captured.

This change stops running the clean up task, as test environments are
always rebuilt in CI, so that the sopy_logs.sh script can detect
the installed modules.

Change-Id: I9e0fe04e6786e1b8b73448c3d85255ffd39804ec
'}, {'created': '2022-03-07 15:31:54.000000000', 'message': 'Skip clean up tasks for litmus tests

The copy_logs.sh script captures log files according to the modules
installed in the directory.

However in litmus tests, the clean up task is executed and removes
all modules before the copy_logs.sh script is executed, and currently
no OpenStack service logs are captured.

This change stops running the clean up task, as test environments are
always rebuilt in CI, so that the sopy_logs.sh script can detect
the installed modules and gather service logs as expected.

Change-Id: I9e0fe04e6786e1b8b73448c3d85255ffd39804ec
'}, {'created': '2022-03-07 23:21:06.000000000', 'message': 'Capture service logs in litmus tests

This change allows gathering logs of OpenStack services in litmus
tests, so that we can check behavior of each services more in detail.

Change-Id: I9e0fe04e6786e1b8b73448c3d85255ffd39804ec

commit_message:
Capture service logs in litmus tests

This change allows gathering logs of OpenStack services in litmus
tests, so that we can check behavior of each services more in detail.

Change-Id: I9e0fe04e6786e1b8b73448c3d85255ffd39804ec

commit_message:
Stop converting integer/boolean in vs_config

Now the vs_config resource type accepts integer or boolean and we don't
need to convert these types to strings.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/823244
Change-Id: Id1d2d6eda7747ae7a751214860eed560a5a32499

commit_message:
Add OpenConfig classes for iface vlan plugging

Add python classes for the subset of the following OpenConfig
modules required to plug ports to VLAN.

* http://openconfig.net/yang/interfaces
* http://openconfig.net/yang/interfaces/ethernet
* http://openconfig.net/yang/vlan

Story: 2009961
Task: 44990
Change-Id: Id7d2ef1d68f36a9827664bf682e4c8050835697e

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-22 14:08:44.000000000', 'message': "make 170-setup-gateway idempotent

Before if we tried to add an address that was already added to the
br-ex device the script would error out. Now, only add the address
if it hasn't been added.

Change-Id: I34bbb361c4fa2f347431629f79753f75b458926f
"}, {'created': '2022-07-22 16:02:36.000000000', 'message': 'make 170-setup-gateway idempotent

Before if we tried to add an address that was already added to the
br-ex device the script would error out. Now, use replace which is
idempotent.

Change-Id: I34bbb361c4fa2f347431629f79753f75b458926f
'}]
commit_message:
make 170-setup-gateway idempotent

Before if we tried to add an address that was already added to the
br-ex device the script would error out. Now, use replace which is
idempotent.

Change-Id: I34bbb361c4fa2f347431629f79753f75b458926f

subject: Revert "Octavia: Mount driver-agent directories only when it is enabled"
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-19 10:43:42.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Octavia: Mount driver-agent directories only when it is enabled"

This reverts commit 381893c0f330cb1e64fcb01d55ae32e3da247a12.

Reason for revert:
The original assumption was wrong. These directories store certificates
used to connect to ovn. So these are required even if driver agent is
not used.

Change-Id: I3ade91de4a73bdb03c92c54d2090e31e64cb3e73
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Octavia: Mount driver-agent directories only when it is enabled"

This reverts commit 381893c0f330cb1e64fcb01d55ae32e3da247a12.

Reason for revert:
The original assumption was wrong. These directories store certificates
used to connect to ovn. So these are required even if driver agent is
not used.

Change-Id: I3ade91de4a73bdb03c92c54d2090e31e64cb3e73

[{'created': '2022-05-18 04:06:50.000000000', 'message': 'Lock down python in tox to 3.9, latest supported version

Without this change, pep8 fails on latest Fedora and Ubuntu
which ship with Python 3.10 as the default.  PEP8 does
not yet run on Python 3.10.

Change-Id: I1dea8ff64ea3fa0efed67f590c3b45bbdbe0f726
'}]
commit_message:
Lock down python in tox to 3.9, latest supported version

Without this change, pep8 fails on latest Fedora and Ubuntu
which ship with Python 3.10 as the default.  PEP8 does
not yet run on Python 3.10.

Change-Id: I1dea8ff64ea3fa0efed67f590c3b45bbdbe0f726

commit_message:
Refactor unit tests of ironic::pxe

This refactors unit tests of the ironic::pxe class according to
the following points.

- Chainload image resource should be tested with default parameters

- Make sure package resources are included

- The resource title for syslinux-tftpboot package is syslinux, instead
  of syslinux-tftpboot.

- 'default_params' and 'p' are not used

Backport note to wallaby:
This backport includes a slight modification to dela with the different
default value of uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name in stable/wallaby.

Change-Id: Ibb1d9b232303c536019e95fc17b3619c791553d4
(cherry picked from commit aab3ad2630034e0478aefc23588166b7678eb077)
(cherry picked from commit f511f93fac870cd5828eab24ffe30073a4191b75)
(cherry picked from commit d30bb0e790150f296db8e5096556f07b6695ca8e)

commit_message:
Remove centos building references

We haven't been building centos images in a long time. Since no
one is currently supporting them, this change removes any of
the centos references.

If someone wishes to support it in the future, these can be added
back.

Change-Id: Icf42b1083346940c607d6e09c42376b11e03fa0d

commit_message:
Check mysql-router pkg version and adjust ssl option

Only affect mysql-router >= 8.0.23
If there is no client_ssl_cert, remove client_ssl_mode anyway.

Change-Id: I24fdfe0b4de6c5681e4576ca6840a882da1682e3
Closes-Bug: #1959861

commit_message:
Bump upper version of puppet-dns

Currently we use puppet-dns 9.3.0 in our jobs. Let's bump the upper
version as we haven't see any issue with that version.

Change-Id: I811c3d7063f4365538f15830c0636896c900be7d

commit_message:
loop htpasswd generation instead of having two tasks

Also set the label to avoid showing the password during task output.

Change-Id: I59a5e333d8fb393fe72c1c9193896f2b59e591cf

commit_message:
Add optional debug timestamps to container logs

This change enables a timestamp format to be defined in chart
values that will be prepended to every log message in the container
log if present.

Change-Id: Ib967a7b0119d87cf754b695b28ad6ba92fcfa4ce

commit_message:
OVN: Remove usage of hiera CLI

The hiera CLI is deprecated[1] in favor of the new ``puppet lookup``
command and doesn't work with the latest hieradata v5.
 [1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/hiera_automatic.html

This change replaces usage of hiera CLI by directly passing values
in ansible task definition.

Change-Id: Iaadba37e3a8e711f2e521441195a2a9db1ebbb69

Change-Id: I232fe835f5a650c258243f1ee4720480f2e6e7b1
'}, {'created': '2022-07-25 11:11:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix container image publish to Docker Hub

Publishing container images to Docker Hub was failing with:

    state is present but all of the following are missing: source

This is caused by the recent Ansible upgrade by Zuul [1]: the source
parameter is mandatory since Ansible 2.12.

commit_message:
Fix container image publish to Docker Hub

Publishing container images to Docker Hub was failing with:

    state is present but all of the following are missing: source

This is caused by the recent Ansible upgrade by Zuul [1]: the source
parameter is mandatory since Ansible 2.12.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/849120

Change-Id: I232fe835f5a650c258243f1ee4720480f2e6e7b1

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-24 20:55:15.000000000', 'message': "Set attach status of temporal volume during backup

A temporal volume for backup can be deleted during backup by
misoperation. Deleting a volume in use may cause unexpected problems.

This patch sets `attach_status` to `attached` when the temporal volume
is actually attached. This prevents the volume from being deleted by a
deletion API even if the API is issued with force. It is necessary to
restore the status to `detached` before deleting the temporal volume
because a volume service doesn't allow to delete a volume whose
`attach_status` is `attached`.

Change-Id: I477d9a005b70962f2ad35115ae4af423f65ecf84
"}, {'created': '2022-02-25 15:31:25.000000000', 'message': "Set attach status of backup volume to avoid deletion

A volume which is connected for backup can be deleted during backup by
misoperation. Deleting a volume in use may cause unexpected problems.

This patch sets `attach_status` to `attached` when a volume is actually
attached for backup. This prevents the volume from being deleted by a
deletion API even if the API is issued with force. It is necessary to
restore the status to `detached` when the volume is disconnected
because a volume service doesn't allow to delete a volume whose
`attach_status` is `attached`.

Change-Id: I477d9a005b70962f2ad35115ae4af423f65ecf84
"}, {'created': '2022-05-03 20:25:03.000000000', 'message': 'Set attach status of backup volume to avoid force deletion

A temporary volume for backup and a volume which is being restored from
a backup can be deleted by misoperation. Although the status of these
volumes are changed not to accept deletion, "force delete" ignores
volume status. Deleting a volume in use may cause unexpected problems.

This patch sets `attach_status` to `attached` when a volume is actually
attached for backup or restore. This prevents the volume from being
deleted by a deletion API even if the API is issued with force.

It is necessary to restore the status to `detached` when the volume is
disconnected. For a temporary volume, this is because a volume service
doesn't allow to delete a volume whose `attach_status` is `attached`
after backup is finished. For a restored volume, it is apparently
necessary for later usage.

Change-Id: I477d9a005b70962f2ad35115ae4af423f65ecf84
Closes-Bug: #1971483
'}, {'created': '2022-05-10 01:32:48.000000000', 'message': "Set attach status of temporary volume to avoid force deletion

A temporary volume for backup can be deleted by misoperation. Although
the status of a temporary volume is 'backing-up', which does not accept
deletion, 'force delete' ignores volume status. Deleting a volume in
use may cause unexpected problems.

This patch sets `attach_status` to `attached` when a volume is actually
attached for backup. This prevents the volume from being deleted by a
deletion API even if the API is issued with force.

It is necessary to restore the status to `detached` when the temporary
volume is deleted after backup is finished because a volume service
doesn't allow to delete a volume whose `attach_status` is `attached`.

Change-Id: I477d9a005b70962f2ad35115ae4af423f65ecf84
Closes-Bug: #1971483
"}, {'created': '2022-05-11 23:58:34.000000000', 'message': "Reject force deletion of volumes used by Cinder services

A volume whose status is 'backing-up' or 'downloading' can be connected
by Cinder services for storing data. Because this case is similar to a
case where a volume is attached by an instance, this volume should not
be deleted even if force deletion is requested.

Change-Id: I477d9a005b70962f2ad35115ae4af423f65ecf84
Closes-Bug: #1971483
"}, {'created': '2022-05-12 19:48:12.000000000', 'message': "Reject force deletion of volumes used by Cinder services

A volume whose status is 'backing-up' or 'downloading' can be connected
by Cinder services for storing data. Because this case is similar to a
case where a volume is attached by an instance, this volume should not
be deleted even if force deletion is requested.

Change-Id: I477d9a005b70962f2ad35115ae4af423f65ecf84
Closes-Bug: #1971483
"}, {'created': '2022-05-16 15:37:04.000000000', 'message': "Reject force deletion of volumes used by Cinder services

A volume whose status is 'backing-up' or 'downloading' can be connected
by Cinder services for storing data. Because this case is similar to a
case where a volume is attached by an instance, this volume should not
be deleted even if force deletion is requested.

Change-Id: I477d9a005b70962f2ad35115ae4af423f65ecf84
Closes-Bug: #1971483
"}, {'created': '2022-06-02 18:15:47.000000000', 'message': "Reject force deletion of volumes used by Cinder services

A volume whose status is 'backing-up' or 'downloading' can be connected
by Cinder services for storing data. Because this case is similar to a
case where a volume is attached by an instance, this volume should not
be deleted even if force deletion is requested.

Change-Id: I477d9a005b70962f2ad35115ae4af423f65ecf84
Closes-Bug: #1971483
"}]
commit_message:
Reject force deletion of volumes used by Cinder services

A volume whose status is 'backing-up' or 'downloading' can be connected
by Cinder services for storing data. Because this case is similar to a
case where a volume is attached by an instance, this volume should not
be deleted even if force deletion is requested.

Change-Id: I477d9a005b70962f2ad35115ae4af423f65ecf84
Closes-Bug: #1971483

commit_message:
Migrate charm charmhub for stable/ussuri

- start from stable/ussuri branch
- Do charmcraft, osci, zuul changes
- Modify libs to point to stable/ussuri for:
  - charmhelpers
  - charms.openstack (as needed)
  - zaza & zaza.openstack.tests
- Remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub.io (ch: prefix + channels)
- Build on 18.04 amd64
- Run on 18.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64

Change-Id: Ica2cf4684a5f31c7d05c607f32875c53050dc9e9

[{'created': '2022-06-29 23:34:39.000000000', 'message': "node extract provisioned - warning no net_conf tpl

Add a warning to the baremetal_deployment.yaml generated
with the node extract provisioned command in case no
network config was found for a role in the deployed stack.

This is always true if the current stack is pre-Victoria, since
the command looks for Ansible J2 template. pre-Victoria used
Heat template so the template parameter won't be set.

Change-Id: I6789799480a1391b92336e2518a2ac2b800288e5
(cherry picked from commit 90ee1b3a72c61302c13567cc75053735172cb7d0)
"}]
commit_message:
node extract provisioned - warning no net_conf tpl

Add a warning to the baremetal_deployment.yaml generated
with the node extract provisioned command in case no
network config was found for a role in the deployed stack.

This is always true if the current stack is pre-Victoria, since
the command looks for Ansible J2 template. pre-Victoria used
Heat template so the template parameter won't be set.

Change-Id: I6789799480a1391b92336e2518a2ac2b800288e5
(cherry picked from commit 90ee1b3a72c61302c13567cc75053735172cb7d0)

[{'created': '2019-05-28 12:07:06.000000000', 'message': 'Support ip6tables for iptables pxe filter

Adds a configuration option [iptables]ip_version to specify the
desired ip version for the iptables pxe filter, which can be set to
4 or 6. When set to 6, the iptables pxe filter will use ip6tables
command to manage rules for the port 547 which is the port of DHCPv6
server side.

The string type is used to make room for the future, when there is need

Change-Id: I7de2be5950a23def3ec6490f2e6dfa3d5c42798a

commit_message:
Support ip6tables for iptables pxe filter

Adds a configuration option [iptables]ip_version to specify the
desired ip version for the iptables pxe filter, which can be set to
4 or 6. When set to 6, the iptables pxe filter will use ip6tables
command to manage rules for the port 547 which is the port of DHCPv6
server side.

The string type is used to make room for the future, when there is need
to automatically determine ip version from the binding interface.

Change-Id: I7de2be5950a23def3ec6490f2e6dfa3d5c42798a
Story: 1756012
Task: 11411
(cherry picked from commit f37eb0fc587a24b3a29a695c2d2b708d2f7c32f2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-16 20:22:49.000000000', 'message': 'devstack: Use uwsgi binary from path; temporary disable grenade

The previous uwsgi invocation assumed that the uwsgi binary is in the
same directory as the project binaries are installed into (probably
/usr/bin).  That may not be correct -- for example if using a packaged
uwsgi on Fedora the binary will live in /usr/sbin/uwsgi (not /usr/bin
where the project files from pip are).

Switch the invocation to just find it in the path.

Additionally, grenade is disabled, otherwise we cannot land this change
without fixing stable branches first.

Change-Id: I7f627fa0bb4850f4839b75df611fa5ab241f1219

Conflicts:
	zuul.d/project.yaml
        (name of the grenade job, multinode-grenade was voting)

Change-Id: I7f627fa0bb4850f4839b75df611fa5ab241f1219
(cherry picked from commit 88b24354a062b089d14ff2b3f9b3b2cbc9123449)
'}, {'created': '2020-06-18 09:26:35.000000000', 'message': 'devstack: Use uwsgi binary from path; temporary disable grenade; pin ibmc

This is a squash of commits 88b24354a062b089d14ff2b3f9b3b2cbc9123449
and f6b9f343581eb430cb339dde09bf97915e2e3a7b.

*devstack: Use uwsgi binary from path; temporary disable grenade*
The previous uwsgi invocation assumed that the uwsgi binary is in the
same directory as the project binaries are installed into (probably
/usr/bin).  That may not be correct -- for example if using a packaged
uwsgi on Fedora the binary will live in /usr/sbin/uwsgi (not /usr/bin
where the project files from pip are).

Switch the invocation to just find it in the path.

Additionally, grenade is disabled, otherwise we cannot land this change
without fixing stable branches first.

Conflicts:
	zuul.d/project.yaml
        (name of the grenade job, multinode-grenade was voting)

*Pin the python-ibmcclient upper bounds due to six usage*

Python-ibmcclient 0.2.0 uses six, which is not installed by default
as it is not necessary for python3 only usage.

This patch pins the upper bounds until the library can be fixed and
a new version released.

Change-Id: I7f627fa0bb4850f4839b75df611fa5ab241f1219
(cherry picked from commit 88b24354a062b089d14ff2b3f9b3b2cbc9123449)
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: Use uwsgi binary from path; temporary disable grenade; pin ibmc

This is a squash of commits 88b24354a062b089d14ff2b3f9b3b2cbc9123449
and f6b9f343581eb430cb339dde09bf97915e2e3a7b.

*devstack: Use uwsgi binary from path; temporary disable grenade*
The previous uwsgi invocation assumed that the uwsgi binary is in the
same directory as the project binaries are installed into (probably
/usr/bin).  That may not be correct -- for example if using a packaged
uwsgi on Fedora the binary will live in /usr/sbin/uwsgi (not /usr/bin
where the project files from pip are).

Switch the invocation to just find it in the path.

Additionally, grenade is disabled, otherwise we cannot land this change
without fixing stable branches first.

Conflicts:
	zuul.d/project.yaml
        (name of the grenade job, multinode-grenade was voting)

*Pin the python-ibmcclient upper bounds due to six usage*

Python-ibmcclient 0.2.0 uses six, which is not installed by default
as it is not necessary for python3 only usage.

This patch pins the upper bounds until the library can be fixed and
a new version released.

Change-Id: I7f627fa0bb4850f4839b75df611fa5ab241f1219
(cherry picked from commit 88b24354a062b089d14ff2b3f9b3b2cbc9123449)

subject: opt: Enhance old stable branches to use latest python-ibmcclient

commit_message:
opt: Enhance old stable branches to use latest python-ibmcclient

Due to some compatibility issue previously, stable branches fix
python-ibmcclient version to python-ibmcclient>=0.1.0,<0.2.0. To let
user benefited from latest python-ibmcclient, will update the code to
support latest version.

Change-Id: I1a9e8a956f0432d2244cba31c1e8b3c4ebdb84a6
Story: 2008144
Task: 40885

commit_message:
Improve performance.json fields

Some dict keys in performance.json file has been changed,
so value of the vield was set to 0, which was not true.
Also improve name of the fields, to suggest type of the performace.json
field.

Change-Id: Ia14f96b8cf8f349ba1cfec07762c70d5b3f4733e

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-22 08:52:33.000000000', 'message': 'Correct attachment_complete call

attachment_complete is called to mark the volume from "attaching"
state to "in-use" state stating that the volume is ready to use.
In the current code, attachment_complete is called before the
brick connection is complete.
This should be done after the connection to brick is successful and
we have a volume path to write the image into.
This patch corrects the behavior.

This patch also adds some useful debug messages to understand which
stage of attachment we are in.

Change-Id: I491b7292a511c47c1d6148dab69ae04269e50c85
'}, {'created': '2021-11-22 09:42:46.000000000', 'message': 'Correct attachment_complete call

attachment_complete is called to mark the volume from "attaching"
state to "in-use" state stating that the volume is ready to use.
In the current code, attachment_complete is called before the
brick connection is complete.
This should be done after the connection to brick is successful and
we have a volume path to write the image into.
This patch corrects the behavior.

This patch also adds some useful debug messages to understand which
stage of attachment we are in.

Change-Id: I491b7292a511c47c1d6148dab69ae04269e50c85
'}, {'created': '2021-11-26 09:56:02.000000000', 'message': "Add debug logs to cinder store

commit_message:
Add debug logs to cinder store

When debugging issues related to glance cinder store, there are
several calls to cinder and it becomes hard to determine which step
we are currently executing without going through cinder logs.
This patch adds some useful debug logs for the new attachment's code
to understand which stage of attachment we are on.

[{'created': '2022-06-17 16:14:53.000000000', 'message': "Split off Ceph related container images

This commit updates the default tripleo_containers jinja template
splitting off the Ceph related container images.
With this new approach pulling the ceph containers is optional,
and can be avoided by setting the 'ceph_images' boolean to False.
To make this possible, a new jinja template processing approach
has been introduced, and a template basedir parameter (required
by the jinja loader) has been added to the BaseImageManager.

In particular:

- the 'template_dir' parameter represents the location path to the
  j2 templates that can be included in the main tripleo containers
  template; a default location (which matches with the default j2
  path) has been added, but if nothing is passed the old behavior
  is maintained;

This is not clean cherry-pick as long as the CephIngress daemon
is not part of the train cherry-pick and in train the default_image
_param() function is in a different path.

Change-Id: I7e337596b653cf635f07a36606e9f673044402a3
