commit_message:
Split off Ceph related container images

This commit updates the default tripleo_containers jinja template
splitting off the Ceph related container images.
With this new approach pulling the ceph containers is optional,
and can be avoided by setting the 'ceph_images' boolean to False.
To make this possible, a new jinja template processing approach
has been introduced, and a template basedir parameter (required
by the jinja loader) has been added to the BaseImageManager.

In particular:

- the 'template_dir' parameter represents the location path to the
  j2 templates that can be included in the main tripleo containers
  template; a default location (which matches with the default j2
  path) has been added, but if nothing is passed the old behavior
  is maintained;

This is not clean cherry-pick as long as the CephIngress daemon
is not part of the train cherry-pick and in train the default_image
_param() function is in a different path.

Change-Id: I7e337596b653cf635f07a36606e9f673044402a3
(cherry picked from commit 08a8118f1b26a170219c63feb8bb5f0b929028c3)
(cherry picked from commit 4e7965ad250eb525699ca8ccda3461ed51e666c2)

commit_message:
Remove wrong equal sign

According to the official doc[1], the syntax was wrong, leading to
issues. It wasn't detected until now, because the option wasn't
actually used.

[1] https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/builder/#arg

Change-Id: Icdbc8d687e1a19ec4015c57acc05d35ddcfd2a77

commit_message:
Fix restarting cinder HA services on config change

Specify the tripleo_ha_wrapper ansible role use a separate marker
file to detect when it should restart the cinder-backup and
cinder-volume services. This ensures both services get restarted
when the config changes. Unless a separate marker file is used
for each service, only the first one (cinder-backup) gets
restarted.

Closes-Bug: #1981591
Change-Id: Ib5c06ab5169942ddaf56a46ad7f14e9497b7e550
(cherry picked from commit 7d76af34f54aa159b0e52d132705659be69b23a1)
(cherry picked from commit 77d0ca4448599e6016c91361a050e7832cc9f970)

commit_message:
Fix import from collections

collections.Mapping has moved to collections.abc.Mapping a long
time ago, and was removed in Python 3.10.

Change-Id: I303ac8fe685913cf2259386cababa4ded03f4866

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes by underscores

Since setuptools v54.1.0[1], the parmeters with dash have been
deprecated in favor of the new parameters with underscore.

This change updates the parameters accordingly to avoid the warnings
like the example below.

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Icc883498d6188f99dd02345880a2c7e7b36902c9

commit_message:
Revert workaround for weak Etags

Return the Etag directly from the headers without modification.
This workarounmd was used for Lenovo nodes who would reject weak etags.
The recent firmware version fixed this issue.

Story: #2009680
Task: #45815
Change-Id: I00944baf227aaa76cfeea9fb16994fb83919aca9

commit_message:
QoS minimum bandwidth documentation: OVN backend

Updated documentation about minimum guaranteed bandwidth support
for OVN backend. This mech driver is capable of informing the
Placement API about the bandwidth resources of each chassis and
schedule a port depending on the minimum bandwidth rules applied.

This patch also updates the document pointing to the new
``resource_requeste`` blob passed to Nova with the information of
the requested resources of each port.

Related-Bug: #1578989
Change-Id: I75401fa64e1ccd814aa485a74b38092849ff2a18

commit_message:
Test: mock out _check_netfilter_for_bridges in unit tests

_check_netfilter_for_bridges do some calls which are not for unit tests.
Specifically the call for sysctl -N net.bridge seems to be broken with
a recent kernel upgrade on bionic (see the irc log for this discussion
in [1]).
Add OS_TEST_TIMEOUT:180 to tox testenv, this can help to debug such
issues.
During the rootwrap to privsep change some of these mocks were added,
(see [2]) so backporting (before Wallaby mostly) can be done with
caution.

[1]: https://meetings.opendev.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2022-07-20.log.html#t2022-07-20T12:59:32
[2]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/764015/12/neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/openvswitch_firewall/test_iptables.py

Change-Id: Ic366d67770cc6e19a4412eaf2f1ab53780e98ee8
Closes-Bug: #1982206

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-31 06:29:18.000000000', 'message': "Added some definitions for recheck purposes.

For now, we can see some instability in running tests, so every time
something goes south, we need to check entire set of tempest tests, to
eliminate false negatives. In this patch we propose to add specific
group of tests that we might want to recheck. So now it will be possible
to just:

- 'recheck amphora' for amphora with ovs/ovn
- 'recheck ovs' for different ovs configurations and tests
- 'recheck ipv6' for running tests against IPv6 configurations.

Change-Id: I786d8ee30d47a860b65c4d8cfdecda0d45ec07b9
"}]
commit_message:
Added some definitions for recheck purposes.

For now, we can see some instability in running tests, so every time
something goes south, we need to check entire set of tempest tests, to
eliminate false negatives. In this patch we propose to add specific
group of tests that we might want to recheck. So now it will be possible
to just:

- 'recheck amphora' for amphora with ovs/ovn
- 'recheck ovs' for different ovs configurations and tests
- 'recheck ipv6' for running tests against IPv6 configurations.

Change-Id: I786d8ee30d47a860b65c4d8cfdecda0d45ec07b9

commit_message:
Fix the trailing-slash issue on for product-streams endpoint

ceph-radosgw is now more strict and can't handle non-canonical
paths in http requests; this patch stopes that happening, and ensures
that the endpoint is set without a trailing slash.

Change-Id: I1c2de2aad2f7652906d91865e5e214b403d2a37b
(cherry picked from commit 91e4aea4511b5d6afa21d18a84ef486097d4f542)

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I242c200a5c403eea35d21e4e8c25bcb23bc756f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-19 13:08:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing condition for ceph custom parameters updates

By adding new ceph jobs that configure their own container
namespaces to run tests against different image tags, we started to
face some issues in standalone role, which has some conflicting
conditions on setting custom ceph parameters.
This patch tries to fix these conditions to make them easier to
use.

Change-Id: If108dc66f15333b7ba90fff980f320e06a21bbff
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing condition for ceph custom parameters updates

By adding new ceph jobs that configure their own container
namespaces to run tests against different image tags, we started to
face some issues in standalone role, which has some conflicting
conditions on setting custom ceph parameters.
This patch tries to fix these conditions to make them easier to
use.

Change-Id: If108dc66f15333b7ba90fff980f320e06a21bbff

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-28 22:56:07.000000000', 'message': 'Parse block device lvm lvs size attributes

The block device lvm lvs `size` attribute was passed directly to
lvcreate, so using units M, G means base 2. All other block device
size values are parsed with accepted conventions of M, B being base 10
and MiB, GiB being base 2.

lvm lvs `size` attributes are now parsed the same as other size
attributes. This improves consistency and makes it practical to
calculate volume sizes to fill the partition size. This means existing
size values will now create slightly smaller volumes. Previous sizes
can be restored by changing the unit to MiB, GiB, or increasing the
value for a base 10 unit.

The impact on this change should be minimal, the only known uses of lvm
volumes (TripleO, and element block-device-efi-lvm) uses extents
percentage instead of size. The smaller sizes can always be increased
after deployment.

Change-Id: Ia109cc5105071d82cc895d8d9cb85bc47da20a7a
'}, {'created': '2022-04-29 01:41:04.000000000', 'message': 'Parse block device lvm lvs size attributes

The block device lvm lvs `size` attribute was passed directly to
lvcreate, so using units M, G means base 2. All other block device
size values are parsed with accepted conventions of M, B being base 10
and MiB, GiB being base 2.

lvm lvs `size` attributes are now parsed the same as other size
attributes. This improves consistency and makes it practical to
calculate volume sizes to fill the partition size. This means existing
size values will now create slightly smaller volumes. Previous sizes
can be restored by changing the unit to MiB, GiB, or increasing the
value for a base 10 unit.

The impact on this change should be minimal, the only known uses of lvm
volumes (TripleO, and element block-device-efi-lvm) uses extents
percentage instead of size. The smaller sizes can always be increased
after deployment.

Requested sizes will also be rounded down to align with physical
extents (4MiB). Previously specifying a value which did not align on
4MiB would consume an extra extent which could unexpectedly consume
more than the partition size.

Change-Id: Ia109cc5105071d82cc895d8d9cb85bc47da20a7a

commit_message:
Parse block device lvm lvs size attributes

The block device lvm lvs `size` attribute was passed directly to
lvcreate, so using units M, G means base 2. All other block device
size values are parsed with accepted conventions of M, B being base 10
and MiB, GiB being base 2.

lvm lvs `size` attributes are now parsed the same as other size
attributes. This improves consistency and makes it practical to
calculate volume sizes to fill the partition size. This means existing
size values will now create slightly smaller volumes. Previous sizes
can be restored by changing the unit to MiB, GiB, or increasing the
value for a base 10 unit.

The impact on this change should be minimal, the only known uses of lvm
volumes (TripleO, and element block-device-efi-lvm) uses extents
percentage instead of size. The smaller sizes can always be increased
after deployment.

Requested sizes will also be rounded down to align with physical
extents (4MiB). Previously specifying a value which did not align on
4MiB would consume an extra extent which could unexpectedly consume
more than the partition size.

Change-Id: Ia109cc5105071d82cc895d8d9cb85bc47da20a7a

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-31 17:59:07.000000000', 'message': 'Support extending encrypted volumes

Patch fixing bug #1861071 resolved the issue of extending LUKS v1
volumes when nova connects them via libvirt instead of through os-brick,
but nova side still fails to extend in-use volumes when they don't go
through libvirt (i.e., LUKS v2).

The logs will show a very similar error, but the user won't know that
this has happened and Cinder will show the new size:

 libvirt.libvirtError: internal error: unable to execute QEMU command
 'block_resize': Cannot grow device files

There are 2 parts to this problem:

- The device mapper device is not automatically extended.
- Nova tries to use the encrypted block device size as the size of the
  decrypted device.

This patch adds new functionality to the encryptors so that they can
extend decrypted volumes to match the size of the encrypted device.

New method added to encryptors is called "extend_volume", and should be
called after the homonymous method in the connector has been called, and
the value returned by the encryptor's extend_volume method is the real
size of the decrypted volume (encrypted volume - headers).

Related-Bug: #1967157
Change-Id: I351f1a7769c9f915e4cd280f05a8b8b87f40df84

commit_message:
LUKS: Support extending host attached volumes

Patch fixing bug #1861071 resolved the issue of extending LUKS v1
volumes when nova connects them via libvirt instead of through os-brick,
but nova side still fails to extend LUKSv2 in-use volumes when they
don't go through libvirt.

The logs will show a very similar error, but the user won't know that
this has happened and Cinder will show the new size:

 libvirt.libvirtError: internal error: unable to execute QEMU command
 'block_resize': Cannot grow device files

There are 2 parts to this problem:

- The device mapper device is not automatically extended.
- Nova tries to use the encrypted block device size as the size of the
  decrypted device.

This patch adds new functionality to the encryptors so that they can
extend decrypted volumes to match the size of the encrypted device.

New method added to encryptors is called "extend_volume", and should be
called after the homonymous method in the connector has been called, and
the value returned by the encryptor's extend_volume method is the real
size of the decrypted volume (encrypted volume - headers).

The patch only adds functionality for LUKS and LUKSv2 volumes, not to
cryptsetup volumes.

Related-Bug: #1967157
Change-Id: I351f1a7769c9f915e4cd280f05a8b8b87f40df84

commit_message:
target/spdknvmf: Add trtype configuration parameter

Adds a choice of rdma or tcp as type of created

commit_message:
Allow Gentoo to manage python versions by itself

Gentoo can manage python versions itself.  Before this commit users were
forced to set python versions themselves.  Now they have the option to
set it if they wish.

The workaround needed for git is also no longer needed, so it's been
removed.

Change-Id: I06b259ef73a40df6b8ab92a5b424bffcf4ef764d
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

commit_message:
cache-url: turn off -x by default

I think that generally this is a lot of noise in the logs, as the
internals of cache-url is well tested, so we don't need to trace log
by default.

Change-Id: I25b5a1ec0d8f99691b2b4b62b9fdd537e5a773e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-22 20:14:29.000000000', 'message': 'CONFIG_FILES is not a constant

The CONFIG_FILES is not a constant, its a method and when this
is passed to the ConfigRenderer it will cause a failure because
the items() function does not exist (since its not a dict).

Change-Id: Ice6cce6a736d96883eb8bc003852c2df60af7c62
Closes-Bug: 1971451
(cherry picked from commit f790b2f64589de7f1fa0390e3b47116e79d086c2)
'}]
commit_message:
CONFIG_FILES is not a constant

The CONFIG_FILES is not a constant, its a method and when this
is passed to the ConfigRenderer it will cause a failure because
the items() function does not exist (since its not a dict).

Change-Id: Ice6cce6a736d96883eb8bc003852c2df60af7c62
Closes-Bug: 1971451
(cherry picked from commit f790b2f64589de7f1fa0390e3b47116e79d086c2)

> Maybe we were wrong to deprecate the uri, this seems more complicated.

> What do the operators say about setting this?

Best to kill the uri option IMO given https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1677913.

I guess the param substitution could be fixed, but then that would break operators/tooling that have worked around the issue.

Could replace the uri option with a new fixed uri option and then deprecating all of the split options... but that might be more confusing.

This patch seems like the least worst option - just completes the set of split options so that the uri option can be removed.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-02 15:29:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-02 15:46:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-10-02 16:21:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-10-02 18:00:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(8 comments)

there are some issue in the commit message.
looking at https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1677913
im not sure it was ever a valid nova bug and i suspect that ooo was incorrectly urlencoding the string.

per the libvirt docs you should only do that for parmaters that libvirt does not support/understand https://libvirt.org/uri.html#Remote_URI_parameters


" Extra parameters can be added to remote URIs as part of the query string (the part following "?"). Remote URIs understand the extra parameters shown below. Any others are passed unmodified through to the back end. Note that parameter values must be URI-escaped. "

if ooo was using unsupproted libvirt paramaters they should have been escaping it properly to conform to our requirements.'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2020-03-31 14:38:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(3 comments)

FWIW this originally affected puppet-nova, which works around it, so not specifically a tripleo issue.

Since puppet-nova doesn't currently use any of the new conf options I would question if they are really necessary.

I also think operators get some value from being able to grok the live_migration_uri e.g to test connectivity with virsh -c <uri>.

It might be better to just create a new option e.g live_migration_uri_template and deprecate live_migration_uri & the new options."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-05-06 14:01:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-05-06 14:06:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-05-06 14:12:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-13 11:35:43.000000000', 'message': "conf: Don't deprecate the 'live_migration_uri'

While the new 'live_migraton_inbound_addr' and 'live_migration_scheme'
introduced in commit 'df334b4f4' provide a more user-friendly approach
to configuring live migration, they do not cover all use cases. Don't
deprecate this option and instead mark it as 'advanced' with
significant warnings that the other options should be preferred by most
users.

Change-Id: I122850d73ff89f6fd611a08446311ba6e0e9d9cd
Closes-Bug: #1671288
"}, {'created': '2017-04-13 16:43:58.000000000', 'message': "WIP! conf: Add three new '[libvirt] live_migration_*' options

Add three new live migration options:

- live_migration_username
- live_migration_extra_params
- live_migration_port

These compliment an existing option:

- live_migration_scheme

These options are necessary to allow full configuration of the live
migration URI without incurring the issues caused by
'live_migration_uri'.

The help text for existing options is clarified.

Change-Id: I122850d73ff89f6fd611a08446311ba6e0e9d9cd
Closes-Bug: #1671288
Related-Bug: #1677913
"}, {'created': '2017-04-18 16:32:59.000000000', 'message': "conf: Add three new '[libvirt] live_migration_*' options

"}, {'created': '2018-05-08 10:52:39.000000000', 'message': "conf: Add three new '[libvirt] live_migration_*' options

Nova uses libvirt-python's migrateToUri2 and migrateToUri3 functions,
which are wrappers around the virDomainMigrateToURI2 [1] and
virDomainMigrateToURI3 [2] C functions, to live migrate instances. As
their name would suggest, these functions require a destination URI and
the format of that URI can vary by hypervisor and deployment.

In order to live migrate an instance, nova needs to generate this
destination URI. To do this, nova can generate a URI that is suitable
for the configured hypervisor assuming an otherwise default
configuration. This is expected to cover 90% of use cases but the URI
generated may not be suitable for deployments with non-default
configuration, such as those using libvirt with a transport other than
TCP. To support these deployments, nova has historically used the
'[libvirt] live_migration_uri' configuration option, which allowed
deployers to specify a templated URI string which nova could then
populate with the destination hostname or IP. For example:

  [libvirt]
  live_migration_uri = qemu+ssh://myuser@%%s/system

This requires the user to fully define the URI, ignoring nova's
(admittedly minimal) smarts here, even if they only wished to override
one component of the URI. More importantly though, as seen above, this
used printf-style string formatting and, due to a quirk in
'oslo.config', required escaping of the formatting characters ('%%'
instead of '%'). This was a common source of user-error that was not
possible to resolve without breaking changes to the option. As a result,
the '[libvirt] live_migration_scheme' option was added, which allowed
users to modify nova's auto-generated URIs slightly to reflect their
chosen transport, without having to resort to the 'live_migration_uri'
configuration option.

Unfortunately, while different transports are now handled (and hostname is
handled by nova), we do not handle the three other components of a URI:
username, port, and extra parameters.

  driver[+transport]://[username@][hostname][:port]/[path][?extraparameters]

As a result, it is not yet possible to remove '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri'. To resolve this issue and close the gap, we must
add three new live migration options to the '[libvirt]' group to
complement the existing 'live_migration_scheme' option.

- live_migration_username
- live_migration_port
- live_migration_extra_params

The combination of these options will allow full configuration of the
live migration URI without incurring the issues caused by '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri' and allow us to finally deprecated that option in a
future release.

The help text for existing options is clarified.

[1] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainMigrateToURI2
[2] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainMigrateToURI3

Change-Id: I122850d73ff89f6fd611a08446311ba6e0e9d9cd
Closes-Bug: #1671288
Related-Bug: #1677913

for the configured hypervisor assuming an otherwise default

generated may not be suitable for deployments with non-default
configuration, such as those using libvirt with a transport other than

deployers to specify a templated URI string which nova could then
populate with the destination hostname or IP. For example:

  [libvirt]
  live_migration_uri = qemu+ssh://myuser@%s/system

This requires the user to fully define the URI, ignoring nova's

used printf-style string formatting and required escaping of the

option was added, which allowed users to modify nova's auto-generated
URIs slightly to reflect their chosen transport, without having to
resort to the 'live_migration_uri' configuration option.

Unfortunately, while different transports are now handled (and hostname is
handled by nova), we do not handle the three other components of a URI:
username, port, and extra parameters.

  driver[+transport]://[username@][hostname][:port]/[path][?extraparameters]

As a result, it is not yet possible to remove '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri'. To resolve this issue and close the gap, we must
add four new live migration options to the '[libvirt]' group to
complement the existing 'live_migration_scheme' option.

- live_migration_username
- live_migration_port
- live_migration_path
- live_migration_extra_params

The combination of these options will allow full configuration of the
live migration URI without incurring the issues caused by '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri' and allow us to finally deprecate that option in a
future release.

The help text for existing options is clarified.

[1] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainMigrateToURI3

around the virDomainMigrateToURI3 [2] C function, to live migrate
instances. As the name would suggest, this function requires a
destination URI and the format of that URI can vary by hypervisor and
deployment.

In order to live migrate an instance, nova needs to generate this
destination URI. To do this, nova can generate a URI that is suitable
for the configured hypervisor assuming an otherwise default
configuration. This is expected to cover 90% of use cases but the URI
generated may not be suitable for deployments with non-default
configuration, such as those using libvirt with a transport other than
TCP. To support these deployments, nova has historically used the
'[libvirt] live_migration_uri' configuration option, which allowed
deployers to specify a templated URI string which nova could then
populate with the destination hostname or IP. For example:

  [libvirt]
  live_migration_uri = qemu+ssh://myuser@%s/system

This requires the user to fully define the URI, ignoring nova's
(admittedly minimal) smarts here, even if they only wished to override
one component of the URI. More importantly though, as seen above, this
used printf-style string formatting and required escaping of the
formatting characters ('%%' instead of '%') so that %foo doesn't get
recognized as a format argument. This was a common source of user-error
that was not possible to resolve without breaking changes to the option.
As a result, the '[libvirt] live_migration_scheme' option was added,
which allowed users to modify nova's auto-generated URIs slightly to
reflect their chosen transport, without having to resort to
the 'live_migration_uri' configuration option.

Unfortunately, while different transports are now handled (and hostname is
handled by nova), we do not handle the three other components of a URI:
username, port, and extra parameters.

  driver[+transport]://[username@][hostname][:port]/[path][?extraparameters]

As a result, it is not yet possible to remove '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri'. To resolve this issue and close the gap, we must
add four new live migration options to the '[libvirt]' group to
complement the existing 'live_migration_scheme' option.

- live_migration_username
- live_migration_port
- live_migration_path
- live_migration_extra_params

The combination of these options will allow full configuration of the
live migration URI without incurring the issues caused by '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri' and allow us to finally deprecate that option in a
future release.

The help text for existing options is clarified.

[1] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainMigrateToURI3

Change-Id: I122850d73ff89f6fd611a08446311ba6e0e9d9cd
Closes-Bug: #1671288
Closes-Bug: #1843883
Related-Bug: #1677913

commit_message:
conf: Add four new '[libvirt] live_migration_*' options

Nova uses libvirt-python's migrateToUri3 function, which is a wrapper
around the virDomainMigrateToURI3 [2] C function, to live migrate
instances. As the name would suggest, this function requires a
destination URI and the format of that URI can vary by hypervisor and
deployment.

In order to live migrate an instance, nova needs to generate this
destination URI. To do this, nova can generate a URI that is suitable
for the configured hypervisor assuming an otherwise default
configuration. This is expected to cover 90% of use cases but the URI
generated may not be suitable for deployments with non-default
configuration, such as those using libvirt with a transport other than
TCP. To support these deployments, nova has historically used the
'[libvirt] live_migration_uri' configuration option, which allowed
deployers to specify a templated URI string which nova could then
populate with the destination hostname or IP. For example:

  [libvirt]
  live_migration_uri = qemu+ssh://myuser@%s/system

This requires the user to fully define the URI, ignoring nova's
(admittedly minimal) smarts here, even if they only wished to override
one component of the URI. More importantly though, as seen above, this
used printf-style string formatting and required escaping of the
formatting characters ('%%' instead of '%') so that %foo doesn't get
recognized as a format argument. This was a common source of user-error
that was not possible to resolve without breaking changes to the option.
As a result, the '[libvirt] live_migration_scheme' option was added,
which allowed users to modify nova's auto-generated URIs slightly to
reflect their chosen transport, without having to resort to
the 'live_migration_uri' configuration option.

Unfortunately, while different transports are now handled (and hostname is
handled by nova), we do not handle the three other components of a URI:
username, port, and extra parameters.

  driver[+transport]://[username@][hostname][:port]/[path][?extraparameters]

As a result, it is not yet possible to remove '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri'. To resolve this issue and close the gap, we must
add four new live migration options to the '[libvirt]' group to
complement the existing 'live_migration_scheme' option.

- live_migration_username
- live_migration_port
- live_migration_path
- live_migration_extra_params

The combination of these options will allow full configuration of the
live migration URI without incurring the issues caused by '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri' and allow us to finally deprecate that option in a
future release.

The help text for existing options is clarified.

[1] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainMigrateToURI3

Change-Id: I122850d73ff89f6fd611a08446311ba6e0e9d9cd
Closes-Bug: #1671288
Closes-Bug: #1843883
Related-Bug: #1677913

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-22 05:03:51.000000000', 'message': "Simulate service_provider fact

Recent puppet-postgresql requires the service_provider fact provided by
puppetlabs-stdlib. This adds the fact as part of the test facts so that
we don't need to inject it in individual spec files.

Change-Id: I7c435f631a9b2541aa2c09ff9c72390d0596ec45
"}, {'created': '2022-07-22 08:51:06.000000000', 'message': "Simulate service_provider fact

commit_message:
Simulate service_provider fact

Recent puppet-postgresql requires the service_provider fact provided by
puppetlabs-stdlib. This adds the fact as part of the test facts so that
we don't need to inject it in individual spec files.

Change-Id: I7c435f631a9b2541aa2c09ff9c72390d0596ec45

commit_message:
[WiP] Add TLS options to keystone authtoken/oslo.cache

This patch specifies a set of options required to build a TLS context.
The context built from those options can later on be passed to any of
the oslo.cache backends that supports TLS connections.

Change-Id: I88e36bff5b24d81e687662e655fb6c5470a15ed6

commit_message:
Migrate charm charmhub for stable/ussuri

- start from stable/ussuri branch
- Do charmcraft, osci, zuul changes
- Modify libs to point to stable/ussuri for:
  - charmhelpers
  - charms.openstack (as needed)
  - zaza & zaza.openstack.tests
- Remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub.io (ch: prefix + channels)
- Build on 18.04 amd64
- Run on 18.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- remove .coveragerc

Change-Id: I43f763c0f93e0bcc647b069199917751900e7e27

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-04 18:50:58.000000000', 'message': "[collectd] Remove processes plugin from default list

Remove the processes plugin from the default collectd plugins list as it
can cause logging to be flooded with messages such as 'procs_running not
found'.

Change-Id: I740a87bdf9ce9fccc34e661c48053ac8c969b5db
Signed-off-by: Leif Madsen <lmadsen@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2022-07-04 18:51:55.000000000', 'message': "[collectd] Remove processes plugin from default list

"}, {'created': '2022-07-05 04:53:40.000000000', 'message': "[collectd] Remove processes plugin from default list

"}, {'created': '2022-07-22 17:19:41.000000000', 'message': "[collectd] Remove processes plugin from default list

Remove the processes plugin from the default collectd plugins list as it
can cause logging to be flooded with messages such as 'procs_running not
found'.

Conflicts:

commit_message:
[collectd] Remove processes plugin from default list

Remove the processes plugin from the default collectd plugins list as it
can cause logging to be flooded with messages such as 'procs_running not
found'.

Conflicts:
	deployment/metrics/collectd-container-ansible.yaml

Change-Id: I740a87bdf9ce9fccc34e661c48053ac8c969b5db
Signed-off-by: Leif Madsen <lmadsen@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 91ee65408e6f4eb70338b42bc7c3791272c14dbd)
(cherry picked from commit 4cd3e12d329fb142caf991768e791d084af27cc2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-15 00:23:47.000000000', 'message': "tempurl: Deprecate sha1 more softly

Still allow sha1 by default, but warn about it the first time a client
uses it. That way, you can upgrade without worrying; any existing users
will not be broken, and ops will still see that there's a deprecation
coming, if it impacts their cluster.

Change-Id: I4ebd92ff9358ca0679716a4af085333dde1f726a
"}, {'created': '2022-06-29 22:31:00.000000000', 'message': 'tempurl: Continue allowing sha1 by default

is happening, removal from default will come soon, and removal of all
support will come after that.

commit_message:
tempurl: Continue allowing sha1 by default

Go back to allowing sha1 by default, but still warn that the deprecation
is happening, removal from default will come soon, and removal of all
support will come after that.

Change-Id: I4ebd92ff9358ca0679716a4af085333dde1f726a

commit_message:
Octavia: Present certificates to driver-agent

The driver-agent process requires access to certificates in case
internal TLS is enabled, so that it can connect to ovn using ssl.

Change-Id: Ib1bfd559a114e5e97530ce1f7ddd1904408614e4

commit_message:
Remove importlib_metadata requirement

The python testing runtime for Zed are 3.8 and 3.9
where importlib_metadata is now part of the library
as importlib.metadata.

The only user is the GCS backup driver, and it already
supported the embedded library, so we can just drop
the codepath for python < 3.8.

Change-Id: Ib1fbb3a9742ad74796bb5a4e6ab2f5d736c00999

The DeprecationWarning was:

  self.assertEqual(table_names, self.storage.engine.table_names())

commit_message:
Fix sqlalchemy table_names DeprecationWarning

This patch updates Designate to use the new method of getting the table names from a sqlalchemy engine. It replaces the use of tables_names() with get_table_names from the sqlalchemy inspector.
The DeprecationWarning was:
SADeprecationWarning: The Engine.table_names() method is deprecated and will be removed in a future release.  Please refer to Inspector.get_table_names(). (deprecated since: 1.4)
  self.assertEqual(table_names, self.storage.engine.table_names())

Change-Id: I99d01a552d24123681e11f746c2e1195634efbfd

subject: Enable cache_ok on custom sqlalchemy UUID type
messages: [{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2022-07-21 17:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2022-07-21 19:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5572, 'date': '2022-07-21 19:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2022-07-23 00:14:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-21 17:53:58.000000000', 'message': 'Enable cache_ok on custom sqlalchemy UUID type

This patch adds the "cache_ok = True" to the custom sqlalchemy UUID type in designate.
It resolves the warning:
designate/sqlalchemy/base.py:243: SAWarning: TypeDecorator UUID() will not produce a cache key because the ``cache_ok`` attribute is not set to True.  This can have significant performance implications including some performance degradations in comparison to prior SQLAlchemy versions.  Set this attribute to True if this type object's state is safe to use in a cache key, or False to disable this warning. (Background on this error at: https://sqlalche.me/e/14/cprf)

Change-Id: Ic3aca3836b331db495109f6b6672e5c8af1d4028
'}]
commit_message:
Enable cache_ok on custom sqlalchemy UUID type

This patch adds the "cache_ok = True" to the custom sqlalchemy UUID type in designate.
It resolves the warning:
designate/sqlalchemy/base.py:243: SAWarning: TypeDecorator UUID() will not produce a cache key because the ``cache_ok`` attribute is not set to True.  This can have significant performance implications including some performance degradations in comparison to prior SQLAlchemy versions.  Set this attribute to True if this type object's state is safe to use in a cache key, or False to disable this warning. (Background on this error at: https://sqlalche.me/e/14/cprf)

Change-Id: Ic3aca3836b331db495109f6b6672e5c8af1d4028

[{'created': '2022-07-21 21:27:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pecan lookup_controller DeprecationWarning

This patch updates Designate for the new funtion signature on pecan
lookup_controller to include the request information if available.

This corrects the following warning we were seeing in Designate:
DeprecationWarning: The function signature for pecan.routing.lookup_controller is changing in the next version of pecan.
Please update to: `lookup_controller(self, obj, remainder, request)`.

Change-Id: Icb206e59c83eec984599d48b3d4719c36eb83734
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pecan lookup_controller DeprecationWarning

This patch updates Designate for the new funtion signature on pecan
lookup_controller to include the request information if available.

This corrects the following warning we were seeing in Designate:
DeprecationWarning: The function signature for pecan.routing.lookup_controller is changing in the next version of pecan.
Please update to: `lookup_controller(self, obj, remainder, request)`.

Change-Id: Icb206e59c83eec984599d48b3d4719c36eb83734

[{'created': '2022-07-22 17:15:26.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve freez graph issue

When we create -options jobs for multinode jobs at [1]
we forgot to add the "branches" for multinode-ipa job
and that is causing freezgraph issue.

commit_message:
Resolve freez graph issue

When we create -options jobs for multinode jobs at [1]
we forgot to add the "branches" for multinode-ipa job
and that is causing freezgraph issue.
This patch basically resolves the freez graph issue for
standalone-on-multinode-ipa jobs for stable/train branch.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/848260/

Change-Id: I5bc7e9f15b4a7137d0f13c2c99ac39682761a991
